metadata.Title: CVE-2021-36084 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The CIL compiler in SELinux 3.2 has a use-after-free in __cil_verify_classperms (called from __cil_verify_classpermission and __cil_pre_verify_helper).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-36084` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsepol1 - 2.7-1ubuntu0.1
sepol-utils - 2.7-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> AppArmor is the default LSM in Ubuntu, issue only affects compilation of selinux policy trusty version predates the introduction of CIL

criterions.comment: libsepol package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7-1ubuntu0.1').
